description: Ratatouille tastes best the day after you make it, and in the summer, you can serve it chilled or at room temperature, with a vinaigrette drizzled over the top Here, it tops a pile of farro Top it with a poached egg, or with crumbled feta or grated Parmesan.
title: Summer Ratatouille With Farro
title_page: Summer Ratatouille With Farro Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
Ratatouille tastes best the day after you make it, and in the summer, you can serve it chilled or at room temperature, with a vinaigrette drizzled over the top. Here, it tops a pile of farro. Top it with a poached egg, or with crumbled feta or grated Parmesan.
Featured in: Just Add Farro.
